decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: PL_051_210531; PL_050_210531; PL_030_210426; PL_031_210426; PL_036_210426; PL_037_210426; PL_038_210426

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - All hard and soft landscape works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details as shown on the approved plans. The works shall be carried out in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner, and any trees which die within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased or are dying, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of same approved specification, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation. All hard surfacing and means of enclosure shall be completed before the development is first occupied.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in the side elevations without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:


   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
description: CONVERSION OF GARAGE INTO HABITABLE SPACE AND INCORPORATION INTO A TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION. ERECTION OF SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION. ERECTION OF ROOF EXTENSION, INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF DORMER WINDOWS AND RAISING THE RIDGE HEIGHT BY ROUGHLY 1M. APPLICATION SEEKS TO AMEND THE APPROVED PLANS UNDER PERMISSION 20/P1443. AMENDMENTS INCLUDE: NON-MATERIAL AMENDMENTS APPROVED UNDER 21/P0228 AND 21/P1104, INCREASING DEPTH OF THE APPROVED REAR TERRACE FROM 300mm TO 325mm, AND CREATION OF REAR GARDEN ROOM BENEATH REAR TERRACE.
